meanings.sent1: He suckered his friend into buying a broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The con artist suckered many people with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox suckered the rabbit into sharing his carrots.
meanings.sent4: The email scam suckered unsuspecting victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trickery suckered the audience into believing the impossible.

meanings.sent1: She felt suckered after realizing the product was a fake.
meanings.sent2: The suckered customers demanded a refund for the faulty product.
meanings.sent3: The poor guy looked so suckered after falling for the prank.
meanings.sent4: The suckered tourists ended up lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent5: The suckered student regretted trusting the wrong classmate.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily fooled or manipulated
meanings.sent1: He was known as the class suckered for believing every tall tale.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist targeted the elderly as easy suckered.
meanings.sent3: The little brother was the family suckered, always falling for pranks.
meanings.sent4: She avoided being the group suckered by staying cautious.
meanings.sent5: The internet is full of traps for the unwary suckered.
